For the coordinate system, use an Euler angle of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0024, 0.0]. First, create a face for the fish body. It will consist of four loops and five arcs. 1. Arc 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.1892] Mid Point: [0.2837, 0.3785] End Point: [0.6025, 0.2577] 2. Arc 2: Start Point: [0.6025, 0.2577] Mid Point: [0.6667, 0.3271] End Point: [0.75, 0.3719] 3. Arc 3: Start Point: [0.75, 0.3719] Mid Point: [0.6983, 0.1892] End Point: [0.75, 0.0066] 4. Arc 5: Start Point: [0.6025, 0.1208] Mid Point: [0.2837, 0.0] End Point: [0.0, 0.1892] Additionally, the face will contain a circle in loop 2, which is used to define the hole within the fish body. 6. Circle 1: Center: [0.1449, 0.2362] Radius: 0.0231 After the face creation, and since it is a single face, you must directly proceed to the extrusion steps. For the extrusion, use an extrude_depth_towards_normal of 0.0151 with an extrude_depth_opposite_normal of 0.0. Set the sketch_scale to 0.75 and the operation as "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to create a new solid body for the fish. Remember that the dimensions for fish body are: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0151 units Once you have completed constructing this part, proceed to the next part(s) for further details on the CAD assembly.</description>
